clinical_study.brief_title: The Application of Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis in Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: The Application of Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis in Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the application of Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis (NAVH) to improve electrical synchrony in Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy (CRT) patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute changes in surface ECG QRS duration resulting from Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy with Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis over a range of programmable values

secondary_outcome.measure: Ambulatory changes in surface ECG QRS duration resulting from Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy with Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis

arm_group.description: Surface ECG recordings will be taken during the adjustment of programmable Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy and Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis settings.

intervention.description: Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy with Negative Atrioventricular Hysteresis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Implanted with a functioning SJM Quadripolar CRT Pacing System
- QRS duration > 140 ms
- Left bundle branch block documented
- Ability to provide informed consent for study participation
- Willing to comply with the study evaluation requirements
- At least 18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- CRT Pacing System implanted less than 1 week at time of enrollment
- CRT Pacing System implanted more than 24 months at time of enrollment
- CRT Pacing System implanted more than 90 days at time of enrollment AND intrinsic QRS duration is shorter than pre-implant intrinsic QRS duration by more than 10 ms
- Resting ventricular rate >100 bpm
- Intrinsic PR interval > 300 ms
- Paroxysmal or persistent atrial tachycardia or atrial fibrillation documented
- A recent myocardial infarction, ablation, drug intoxication, electrolyte imbalance, or any condition within the last 90 days that would be contraindicated for CRT programming changes in the opinion of the investigator
- Women who are pregnant or who plan to become pregnant during the study
